(= 50ml per plate)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl518","text":"- Get a box full of ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e50q9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3qid","text":"This protocol is designed for a 96-well plate (LoBind).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bve7f","text":"Here, we present a protocol which enables the comprehensive characterization of the RNA content of single phase-separated coacervates. We adapted single-cell RNA sequencing technology in combination with fluorescence activated cell sorting (FACS)  to answer the question of how one condensate differs from the other in terms of RNA composition and how it relates to condensate features such as droplet size. This approach represents a powerful addition to labor intensive and low throughput microscopy approaches which have been the state of the art approach for coacervate RNA characterization. This protocol includes droplet production, as well as a Smart-seq2 protocol adaption for lysis, reverse transcription and cDNA amplification and sequencing library preparation. This protocol ends with the library preparation. Afterwards it got sequenced on an Illumina NextSeq500 (paired end for 300 cycles).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehfb1","text":"The Smart-seq2 protocol was originally published in Picelli, S., Faridani, O., Björklund, Å. et al. Full-length RNA-seq from single cells using Smart-seq2. Nat Protoc9, 171–181 (2014). https://doi.org/10.1038/nprot.2014.006","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":93,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":156,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":166,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c034n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9428h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dla9t","text":"Follow the general guidelines for working with RNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6204","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pcoa","text":"- wear clean gloves all the time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f7a5","text":"- use sterile equipment and sterile disposable plasticware","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmc23","text":"- use a designated area for RNA work only","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd8tp","text":"- use RNase inactivating reagents to clean equipment and surfaces","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hedt","text":"- Use RNase/DNase free filter tips instead of normal tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1pel","text":"- work preferably quick and on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biubv","text":"- avoid handling over open bottles/tubes/etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg1sj","text":"- avoid RNase contamination through air","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kgms","text":"- use RNase free water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85jn5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42f0j","text":"- RNA storage temperature is -80°C, avoid defrosting cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
